Detailed Description

Defines the context which will be used by any graphical operation.

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum DeviceContext::AlphaBlendingMode
 

Defines the kind of alpha blending which can be set by DeviceContext::SetAlphaBlendingMode.

Enumerator:
MaskAlphaBlending  The alpha mask is stored separatly. This mode is useful when drawing on a bitmap by a BitmapDc, which will be drawn on the display afterwards.
ImmediateAlphaBlending  The drawing operations are immediatly blended to the background.

enum DeviceContext::RasterOp
 

Enumerator:
OverpaintRop 
AndRop 
OrRop 
XorRop 
NXorRop 
InvertRop 

enum DeviceContext::TransformationMode
 

Bitmaps may be rotated and/or mirrored on the fly. The transformation-mode describes the kind of transformation. See DeviceContext::DrawBitmap for additional information.

Enumerator:
NoTransformation  Draws with no transformation.
MirrorRot180  Draws the bitmap horizontally mirrored and rotated by 180 degrees.
Mirror  Draws the bitmap horizontally mirrored.
Rot180  Draws the bitmap rotated by 180 degrees.
MirrorRot270  Draws the bitmap horizontally mirrored and rotated by 270 degrees to the left.
Rot90  Draws the bitmap rotated by 90 degrees to the left.
Rot270  Draws the bitmap rotated by 270 degrees to the left.
MirrorRot90  Draws the bitmap horizontally mirrored and rotated by 90 degrees to the left.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

If the default constructor is used, the parameters have to be provided by using the method Init.

Member Function Documentation

void DeviceContext::AdjustBoundingRect (   )  [protected, virtual]
 

Reimplemented in BitmapDc, ClientDc, DisplayDc, and FrameDc.

void DeviceContext::BeginUpdate (   ) 
 

Use BeginUpdate on the beginning of a group of graphical operations. Every group of graphical operations has to be encapsulated between BeginUpdate and EndUpdate. Nesting of BeginUpdate/EndUpdate is allowed.

void DeviceContext::ClearRect (  XYDIM  left,
XYDIM  top,
XYDIM  right,
XYDIM  bottom
)  [inline]
 

Wrapper-method for ClearRect(const Rect& rect).

void DeviceContext::ClearRect (  const Rect &  rect  ) 
 

Clears a rectangle given by rect using the system color CLIENT_BACKGROUND.

void DeviceContext::DrawArc (  XYDIM  x1,
XYDIM  y1,
XYDIM  x2,
XYDIM  y2,
INT  start_angle,
INT  arc_angle
) 
 

Draws an arc with the pen-color. Please note that drawing an arc is a quite expensive operation; it is recommended not to use it inside an APOXI-theme for drawing e. g. round corners of a window. Use a bitmap instead or do the drawing with DrawLine.

Parameters:
x1 X-position of the upper-left corner of the arc to be drawn.
y1 Y-position of the upper-left corner of the arc to be drawn.
x2 X-position of the lower-right corner of the rectangle of the arc.
y2 Y-position of the lower-right corner of the rectangle of the arc.
start_angle The start angle of the arc.
arc_angle The angular extent of the arc, relative to the start.

void DeviceContext::DrawBitmap (  XYDIM  x,
XYDIM  y,
const BitmapRes &  bmp,
TransformationMode  trans_mode = NoTransformation
) 
 

Parameters:
x Horizontal position of the bitmaps upper left corner.
y Vertical position of the bitmaps upper left corner.
bmp Bitmap which should be drawn.
trans_mode Transformation-mode, which should be applied. Is currently not implemented and will be available in APOXI-1.10.0.

void DeviceContext::DrawCircle (  XYDIM  x,
XYDIM  y,
XYDIM  radius,
BOOLEAN  fill = FALSE
) 
 

Draws a circle with the pen-color.

Parameters:
x X-position of the middle of the circle.
y Y-position of the middle of the circle.
radius Radius of the circle.
fill If TRUE, the circle will be filled with the brush-color.

void DeviceContext::DrawPolygon (  const XYDIM  x[],
const XYDIM  y[],
INT  edges_count,
BOOLEAN  fill = FALSE
) 
 

Draws a polygon with the pen-color.

Parameters:
x Pointer to an array of x-coordinates.
y Pointer to an array of y-coordinates.
edges_count Number of edges, which are described by the x- and y-arrays. edges_count must be >= 3.
fill If TRUE, the polygon will be filled with the brush-color.

void DeviceContext::DrawRect (  XYDIM  left,
XYDIM  top,
XYDIM  right,
XYDIM  bottom,
BOOLEAN  fill = FALSE
)  [inline]

void DeviceContext::DrawRect (  const Rect &  rect,
BOOLEAN  fill = FALSE
) 
 

Draws a rectangle with the pen-color.

Parameters:
rect Rectangle to be drawn.
fill If TRUE, the rectangle will be filled with the brush-color.

void DeviceContext::DrawRoundRect (  XYDIM  x1,
XYDIM  y1,
XYDIM  x2,
XYDIM  y2,
XYDIM  arc_width,
XYDIM  arc_height
) 
 

Draws the outline of a rounded corner rectangle (also circle or ellipse) with pen color. Please note that drawing a rounded rectangle is a quite expensive operation; it is recommended not to use it inside an APOXI-theme for drawing e. g. round corners of a window. Use a bitmap instead or do the drawing with DrawLine.

Parameters:
x1 X-position of the upper-left corner.
y1 Y-position of the upper-left corner.
x2 X-position of the lower-right corner of the rectangle.
y2 Y-position of the lower-right corner of the rectangle.
arc_width The horizontal diameter of the arc at the corners.
arc_height The vertical diameter of the arc at the corners.

void DeviceContext::DrawText (  XYDIM  x,
XYDIM  y,
const WCHAR *  text,
INT  from = 0,
INT  char_count = -1,
BidiManager::ParagraphContext *  context = 0
) 
 

Draws a single line of text.

Parameters:
x Horizontal starting point of the text.
y Vertical starting point of the text.
text Text to be drawn.
from Index of the character where the drawing starts.
char_count Number of characters to be drawn (-1 means until ).
context Pointer to the paragraph-context provided by the bidi-manager, which might be needed for the output of bidirectional text. If no context is given, the current text is taken as paragraph-context.
See also:
BidiManager

void DeviceContext::DrawTextBox (  const Rect &  box_rect,
const WCHAR *  text,
INT  from = 0,
INT  char_count = -1,
BOOLEAN  center_vertical = FALSE,
XYDIM  line_gap = 0
) 
 

Draws text into a rectangular area with automatically word wrapping.

Parameters:
box_rect Rectangle, which defines the boundaries of the text.
text Pointer to the text, which should be drawn.
from Start index of first character which should be drawn.
char_count Number of characters which should be drawn. -1 stands for all characters.
center_vertical If set to TRUE, the text will be centered vertically inside the bounding-rectangle. If set to FALSE, the text will be aligned on the top.
line_gap Specifies the vertical gap between two lines.
See also:
DrawText

void DeviceContext::DrawTextInvert (  XYDIM  x,
XYDIM  y,
const WCHAR *  text,
INT  from = 0,
INT  char_count = -1
) 
 

Calls DrawText and afterwards InvertRect with the width and height of the text.

See also:
DrawText

void DeviceContext::EndUpdate (   ) 
 

Use EndUpdate at the end of a group of graphical operations.

See also:
BeginUpdate

void DeviceContext::FillArc (  XYDIM  x1,
XYDIM  y1,
XYDIM  x2,
XYDIM  y2,
INT  start_angle,
INT  arc_angle
) 
 

Fills an arc with the brush color. Please note that drawing an arc is a quite expensive operation; it is recommended not to use it inside an APOXI-theme for drawing e. g. round corners of a window. Use a bitmap instead or do the drawing with DrawLine.

Parameters:
x1 X-position of the upper-left corner of the arc to be drawn.
y1 Y-position of the upper-left corner of the arc to be drawn.
x2 X-position of the lower-right corner of the rectangle of the arc.
y2 Y-position of the lower-right corner of the rectangle of the arc.
start_angle The start angle of the arc.
arc_angle The angular extent of the arc, relative to the start.

void DeviceContext::FillCircle (  XYDIM  x,
XYDIM  y,
XYDIM  radius
)  [inline]
 

Draws a filled circle with the brush-color.

Parameters:
x X-position of the middle of the circle.
y Y-position of the middle of the circle.
radius Radius of the circle.

void DeviceContext::FillPolygon (  const XYDIM  x[],
const XYDIM  y[],
INT  edges_count,
const BitmapRes *  texture = 0
) 
 

Draws a filled polygon with the brush-color. Current restriction: filling only works on convex polygons.

Parameters:
x Pointer to an array of x-coordinates.
y Pointer to an array of y-coordinates.
edges_count Number of edges, which are described by the x- and y-arrays. edges_count must be >= 3.
texture Optional parameter which specifies the texture the polygon should be filled with. If a texture is specified, the brush-color is ignored.

void DeviceContext::FillRect (  XYDIM  left,
XYDIM  top,
XYDIM  right,
XYDIM  bottom
)  [inline]
 

Wrapper-method for FillRect(const Rect& rect).

void DeviceContext::FillRect (  const Rect &  rect  ) 
 

Fills a rectangle with the brush-color.

void DeviceContext::FillRoundRect (  XYDIM  x1,
XYDIM  y1,
XYDIM  x2,
XYDIM  y2,
XYDIM  arc_width,
XYDIM  arc_height
) 
 

Fills in a rounded corner rectangle (also circle or ellipse) with brush color. Please note that drawing a rounded rectangle is a quite expensive operation; it is recommended not to use it inside an APOXI-theme for drawing e. g. round corners of a window. Use a bitmap instead or do the drawing with DrawLine.

Parameters:
x1 X-position of the upper-left corner.
y1 Y-position of the upper-left corner.
x2 X-position of the lower-right corner of the rectangle.
y2 Y-position of the lower-right corner of the rectangle.
arc_width The horizontal diameter of the arc at the corners.
arc_height The vertical diameter of the arc at the corners.

Rect DeviceContext::GetClipRect (   )  const
 

Returns the clipping rectange where each graphical operation gets clipped. It is assured that the clipping rectangle is inside the boundaries of the device context.

Control* DeviceContext::GetControl (   )  [inline, protected]
 

VirtualDisplay* DeviceContext::GetDisplay (   )  const [inline]
 

Returns a pointer to the virtual display of the device context. Note that using the virtual display directly should not be necessary inside the MMI and used with care.

const Font & DeviceContext::GetFont (   )  const
 

Returns the font which is used for text drawing methods like DeviceContext::DrawText and DeviceContext::DrawTextBox.

RasterOp DeviceContext::GetRasterOp (   )  const [inline]
 

Obsolete - raster operations are note supported anymore due to having an alpha channel.

TextAlign DeviceContext::GetTextAlign (   )  const [inline]
 

Returns the text alignment which is used for the text drawing method DeviceContext::DrawTextBox. Note that the text alignment is ignored by the method DeviceContext::DrawText, as a rectangular area is required for the alignment.

TextAttr DeviceContext::GetTextAttr (   )  const [inline]
 

Returns the attributes of the text (Normal, Underlined, Italic, Bold, Strikethrough), which is used for the text drawing methods DeviceContext::DrawText and DeviceContext::DrawTextBox.

const TextFormat& DeviceContext::GetTextFormat (   )  const [inline]
 

Returns the textformat which is used for text drawing methods like DeviceContext::DrawText and DeviceContext::DrawTextBox.

void DeviceContext::InvertRect (  const Rect &  rect  )

BOOLEAN DeviceContext::IsInForeground (   )  [inline]
 

Returns:
TRUE, if the drawing of the device context will be done in the foreground, so that no window overlaps the drawing area of the device context. This allows to add speed improvements for certain situations by using the display device in a direct manner. Note that using the display device directly should not be necessary for application developers for default use cases.

BOOLEAN DeviceContext::Obtain (  const Ticks &  timeout  )  [static]
 

This method is invoked by the window-system to assure, that a device-context may only be obtained by one thread. It should not be necessary for the application programmer to use this method.

static void DeviceContext::Release (   )  [inline, static]
 

Release the device-context for other threads. See DeviceContext::Obtain for details.

UINT8  green,
UINT8  blue,
UINT8  alpha = 255
)  [inline]
 

Sets the color of the brush to the value represented by red-, green- and blue-portions. Optionally an alpha-channel can be specified.

Sets the brush color which is used for drawing methods like DeviceContext::FillRect or DeviceContext::FillCircle.

void DeviceContext::SetBrushStyle (  BrushStyle  brush_style  )  [inline]
 

Sets the brush style which is used for drawing methods like DeviceContext::FillRect or DeviceContext::FillCircle.

void DeviceContext::SetClipRect (  const Rect &  clip_rect  ) 
 

After calling this method every graphical operation will be clipped to this rectangle. It is recommended before setting the clipping rectangle to intersect the wished rectangle with the existing clipping rectangle to assure an optimized clipping and prevent overdrawing other components:
PaintDc pdc(GetDeviceContext());
Rect my_clip_rect(0, 0, 100, 50);
my_clip_rect.Intersect(pdc.GetClipRect());
pdc.SetClipRect(my_clip_rect);

Parameters:
clip_rect New clipping rectangle.

void DeviceContext::SetControl (  Control *  control  ) 
 

Sets the control where the device context is embedded into. It should not be necessary for the application programmer to use this method.

void DeviceContext::SetDisplay (  VirtualDisplay *  display  )  [inline, protected]

Sets the pen which is used for drawing methods like DeviceContext::DrawLine or DeviceContext::DrawRect.

void DeviceContext::SetPenColor (  SystemColorId  system_color_id  ) 
 

Sets the pen color which is used for drawing methods like DeviceContext::DrawLine or DeviceContext::DrawRect.

void DeviceContext::SetPenColor (  const Color &  color  )  [inline]
 

Sets the pen color which is used for drawing methods like DeviceContext::DrawLine or DeviceContext::DrawRect.

void DeviceContext::SetPenColorHsv (  UINT8  hue,
UINT8  saturation,
UINT8  value,
UINT8  alpha = 255
)  [inline]
 

Sets the color of the pen to the value represented by hue, saturation and the value. Optionally an alpha-channel can be specified.

void DeviceContext::SetPenColorRgb (  UINT8  red,
UINT8  green,
UINT8  blue,
UINT8  alpha = 255
)  [inline]
 

Sets the color of the pen to the value represented by red-, green- and blue-portions. Optionally an alpha-channel can be specified.

void DeviceContext::SetPenColorValue (  ColorValue  color_value  )  [inline]
 

Sets the pen color value which is used for drawing methods like DeviceContext::DrawLine or DeviceContext::DrawRect.

void DeviceContext::SetPenStyle (  PenStyle  pen_style  )  [inline]
 

Sets the pen style which is used for drawing methods like DeviceContext::DrawLine or DeviceContext::DrawRect.

void DeviceContext::SetRasterOp (  RasterOp  raster_op  )  [inline]
 

Obsolete - raster operations are note supported anymore due to supporting an alpha channel.

void DeviceContext::SetTextAlign (  TextAlign  text_align  )  [inline]
 

Sets the text alignment which is used for the text drawing method DeviceContext::DrawTextBox. Note that the text alignment is ignored by the method DeviceContext::DrawText, as a rectangular area is required for the alignment.

void DeviceContext::SetTextAttr (  TextAttr  text_attr  )  [inline]
 

Sets the attributes of the text (Normal, Underlined, Italic, Bold, Strikethrough), which is used for the text drawing methods DeviceContext::DrawText and DeviceContext::DrawTextBox. Setting two attributes at the same time can be done the following way: dc.SetTextAttr(TextFormat::Italic | TextFormat::Bold);

void DeviceContext::SetTextFormat (  const TextFormat &  text_format  )  [inline]
 

Sets the textformat which is used for text drawing methods like DeviceContext::DrawText and DeviceContext::DrawTextBox.

void DeviceContext::SetWidth (  XYDIM  width  )  [protected, virtual]
 

void DeviceContext::UpdateAbsPos (  XYDIM  dx,
XYDIM  dy
)  [protected]
 

void DeviceContext::UpdateDisplay (   )  const
 

Only use UpdateDisplay() if an immediately display update is necessary. Under normal circumstances the display will be updated during the next idle state of the application.
